actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB; Treasury Department; Health and Human Services Department.

official_title: A bill to amend Title II of the Social Security Act to permit borrowing between Social Security trust funds under specified conditions when necessary to assist in financing the old age and survivors program.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to permit the Trustees of the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund to borrow from the Disability Insurance Trust Fund or the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund, prior to fiscal year 1991, in any month in which the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund falls below 20 percent of the amount of its disbursements for the 12 months preceding the borrowing. Provides for the repayment of any such loan.

titles.title: A bill to amend Title II of the Social Security Act to permit borrowing between Social Security trust funds under specified conditions when necessary to assist in financing the old age and survivors program.
